body: 4.0.0-RC2 is still in dev branch

thanks. use your props key.sql monitor success.

I just close this issue because the scope is too big.
If someone want to implement with a new database, should talk about how to parse sql, how to implement database protocol and so on.
If some one really want to do this, please contact us again.

I just close this issue because to implement all JDBC interface for sharding is too much work to do.
If somebody want to implement one of unimplement method, please contact us by a feature request and talk how to implement method technically.

How to integrate with other framework is much work to do, and we don't have enough time to do this.
Does anybody want to debug integrate with shardingsphere and spring batch? 
If no, I will close this issue later.
unit test will be added in another issue.
微脉 [http://www.myweimai.com/](http://www.myweimai.com/)
Enhancement tasks will be discuss further in other issues.

Spring batch is just an example, because sharding takes over the connection, so you can't rule out the problem caused by the fragmented database source. Then spring batch combined with sharding is for data migration, because not all projects use sharding at the beginning. In order to combine the use of sharding in new projects, only old data can be migrated.
all tables  , one  hint  algorithmClassName
I really can't reproduce this problem. Please double check whether you **mvn clean install** after you update the code. And provide moe information.
The problem had been fixed, please update the 4.0.0-RC2 code, and make sure **mvn clean install**.
The title is too gerneric, could you change title for focus on problem details?

1. Please set sql.show: true, and put on the logs with SQLs.
2. Please provide your sharding configuration.
3. Please double check your version. I wonder why you using **4.0.0-RC1-SNAPSHOT**? If you do use **4.0.0-RC1-SNAPSHOT**, please update to **4.0.0-RC2-SNAPSHOT** and have a try.
I cannot get your point, maybe you need explain more. For hint, you may reference example: https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example/tree/dev/sharding-jdbc-example/hint-example

Fixed by https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/pull/2595.

There's something wrong with the shardingRule.
You can either change **actualDataNodes** to ds_${0..1}.book_${0..1} or,
remove the defaultDatabaseStrategy.
The solution depends on your actual databases;

I use **mvn clean install -Prelease -DskipTests** to generate tar package.
Here is the link to download my debug log [stdout.zip](https://airportal.cn/?code=2535)

Thank you
How to deal with if byte[]' size > 1?
Not release yet, you can see https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/releases to find release info

Key 'k_distribute_time_bw_borrower_flow' doesn't exist in table 'bw_borrower_flow'

Just check your database's index
This problem is your environment's problem probably, shardingsphere never write code must depend special jdk
Maybe you should learn or understand how to use hibernate, or submit this issue to hibernate's github repo
Closed because no response anymore

Please list the running environment
我使用spring boot 高版本也出现这个问题  使用spring boot 2.0.3.RELEASE parent使用spring-boot-starter-parent 2.0.6.RELEASE 可以解决
our index is k_distribute_time, the real reason is SS rewrite the index name to 'k_distribute_time_bw_borrower_flow' ， but table bw_borrower_flow no shardingRule。

the version 3.1.0 is never released, please choose a release one.
FIY: https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/releases

Hi, it is great suggestion, but placeholder will be combined with token object, so maybe those toString() functions will be changed afterwards. I think maybe it's better to do those optimizations after we finish the combination of placeholder object and token object. What do you think?

The ResultSetUtil#convertByteArrayValue method references to MySQL JDBC driver 5.1 version, it just checks first of byte array.In 8.0 version, it changes to byte array -> long -> boolean, you can find the implement in [here](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-j/blob/release/8.0/src/main/core-impl/java/com/mysql/cj/result/BooleanValueFactory.java#L78), I’m not sure which way is better, what do you think? BTW, this method has only been verified in the MySQL database, I don't have an environment for other databases.
@tristaZero. Thank you. I agree with you. So, shall I close this issue?

@KomachiSion I encounter same problem and use the configuration you figure out. Works well. But I noticed [that ](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/wiki/Spring-Boot-2.1-Release-Notes#bean-overriding). This may be make some problem do not konw.
So I do not think this is the best way.
I prefer no, because route without sharding key is a normal function which to route to all data nodes for OLAP
Not yet, oracle is not a mainly support for us, so we have already open spi for oracle parse. If somebody interested with oracle, please pr on oracle module.
please translate Chinese words to english first
For other database it is a problem, could you verify for other database too?
Any update? Or can I close this issue soon?
No response anymore, closed for now

@duaicxx, `sharding-jdbc-spring-boot-starter` only provide a simple way to configure sharding datasource as `DataSource` bean.
Any other `spring-boot-starter` which auto configure `DataSource` bean will cause bean conflict or bean override. This is not the responsibility of ShardingSphere.

For your example,  I think you can try to set `default-data-source-name=test` make these tables route to a independent datasource.
Or you can program custom `@Configuration` to configure multiple `DataSource` bean.

And if you have any idea solved the multiple `DataSource` bean problem, We welcome you initiate a discussion on issue or dev mail-list.

@xiaotianlongxing, Hint is sharding strategy, it should be injected into `table-strategy-ref` or `database-strategy-ref`

In your example, you injected `sharding:standard-strategy` not `sharding:hint-strategy`, so this function will not be called.

you can change like following and retry

```
<bean id="tableShardingAlgorithmByMonth" class="com.xxx.TableShardingAlgorithmByMonth"></bean>
<bean id="hintTestBean" class="com.xxx.ModuloHintShardingAlgorithm"></bean>
<sharding:hint-strategy id="hintStrategy"  algorithm-ref="hintTestBean" ></sharding:hint-strategy>
<sharding:standard-strategy id="payOrderPreciseAlgorithm" sharding-column="create_date" precise-algorithm-ref="tableShardingAlgorithmByMonth"></sharding:standard-strategy>
<sharding:data-source id="shardingDataSource">
    <sharding:sharding-rule data-source-names="dataSource">
        <sharding:table-rules>
            <sharding:table-rule logic-table="pay_order" table-strategy-ref="hintStrategy"  />
        </sharding:table-rules>
        <sharding:binding-table-rules>
            <sharding:binding-table-rule logic-tables="pay_order"/>
        </sharding:binding-table-rules>
    </sharding:sharding-rule>
    <sharding:props>
        <prop key="sql.show">false</prop>
    </sharding:props>
</sharding:data-source>
```

Of course, you can inject `sharding:hint-strategy` as a default table strategy like 
```
<bean id="tableShardingAlgorithmByMonth" class="com.xxx.TableShardingAlgorithmByMonth"></bean>
<bean id="hintTestBean" class="com.xxx.ModuloHintShardingAlgorithm"></bean>
<sharding:hint-strategy id="hintStrategy"  algorithm-ref="hintTestBean" ></sharding:hint-strategy>
<sharding:standard-strategy id="payOrderPreciseAlgorithm" sharding-column="create_date" precise-algorithm-ref="tableShardingAlgorithmByMonth"></sharding:standard-strategy>
<sharding:data-source id="shardingDataSource">
    <sharding:sharding-rule data-source-names="dataSource" default-table-strategy-ref="hintStrategy">
        <sharding:table-rules>
            <sharding:table-rule logic-table="pay_order" table-strategy-ref="payOrderPreciseAlgorithm"  />
        </sharding:table-rules>
        <sharding:binding-table-rules>
            <sharding:binding-table-rule logic-tables="pay_order"/>
        </sharding:binding-table-rules>
    </sharding:sharding-rule>
    <sharding:props>
        <prop key="sql.show">false</prop>
    </sharding:props>
</sharding:data-source>
```

There are java-raw hint example for 4.0.0+ version: https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example/tree/dev/sharding-jdbc-example/hint-example
